unnormalised: Guys, Delhi traffic's getting a serious makeover! New traffic regulations are coming into effect just before Diwali, and you know what that means - extra chaos or smoother rides? Let's see!
normalised: Guys, Delhi traffic is getting a serious makeover! New traffic regulations are coming into effect just before Diwali, and you know what that means - extra chaos or smoother rides? Let's see!

unnormalised: Apparently, there's a crackdown on signal jumping near Connaught Place, with hefty fines (think upwards of Rs. 5000!) being dished out. They're also implementing stricter lane discipline on the Delhi-Gurgaon expressway - no more zig-zagging like you're avoiding potholes after the monsoon!
normalised: Apparently, there's a crackdown on signal jumping near Connaught Place, with hefty fines (think upwards of rupee five thousand!) being dished out. They're also implementing stricter lane discipline on the Delhi-Gurgaon expressway - no more zig-zagging like you're avoiding potholes after the monsoon!

unnormalised: The Delhi Traffic Police are saying this is all to improve road safety and reduce congestion. But honestly, will it stop Uncle Sharma from cutting you off while trying to grab that last plate of biryani at the roadside stall?
normalised: The Delhi Traffic Police are saying this is all to improve road safety and reduce congestion. But honestly, will it stop Uncle Sharma from cutting you off while trying to grab that last plate of biryani at the roadside stall?

unnormalised: Also, speed limits are being revised on several stretches. Pay close attention, especially on the Outer Ring Road – reports say some limits are being reduced by 10-20 km/hr. That chai break can wait; focus on the road! So, buckle up, folks, and drive safe! Better to be stuck in traffic than stuck with a challan. And Happy Diwali in advance!
normalised: Also, speed limits are being revised on several stretches. Pay close attention, especially on the Outer Ring Road – reports say some limits are being reduced by ten to twenty kilometer per hour. That chai break can wait; focus on the road! So, buckle up, folks, and drive safe! Better to be stuck in traffic than stuck with a challan. And Happy Diwali in advance!
